poll_list.title: Whitelist Set Protocol on Multiple Oracles - January 11, 2021

discourse_list.title: MIP10c9-SP24: Subproposal to whitelist Set for ZRX/USD Oracle Access

content.content: MIP10c9-SP24: Subproposal to whitelist Set Protocol for ZRX/USD Oracle Access Preamble MIP10c9-SP#: 24 Author(s): Alex Soong Contributors: Alex Soong Status: Formal Submission Date Proposed: 2020-1-2 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd>  Specification Introduction Net asset value (NAV) issuance allows Set users to issue Sets based on the prices of the component tokens within a Set. To enable NAV issuance for a wider variety of Set compositions, we are requesting access to additional Maker oracles. Oracle Name ZRX/USD Customer(s) Alex Soong - [email protected]protocol.com Whitelist ZRX Oracle Proxy - 0xFF60D1650696238F81BE53D23b3F91bfAAad938f - MedianZRXUSD ( 0x956ecD6a9A9A0d84e8eB4e6BaaC09329E202E55e) Requirements For each customer address to be whitelisted:  Is the contract source code verified on etherscan? yes Is the Oracle data used in a permissioned manner that would prevent parasitic behavior? yes Is Oracle data written to storage? no If Oracle data is stored, is it stored in a private variable? n/a If Oracle data is stored, is the value accessible on-chain exclusively by the protocol? n/a  Fee In accordance with the Responsible Oracle Migration Proposal, fees are waived for the first year and determined by MKR Governance after that.

After reviewing the provided OracleProxy contract the Oracle Domain Team has concluded the Oracle data is not stored in memory and is accessible exclusively by authorized parties. The contract also includes a function to change to new Oracle address which will facilitate migration should the need arise.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
